no, it means the actual ADSL modem device acts as a bridge passing on the ppp connection to the ISP's servers to establish the link, and effective drops out of the link between ISP and PPP client
well that sucks that it drops out right?
no, it's a great way to do it. It avoids having to do  IP routing between ADSL modem and server
wats and ADSL modem?

as far as the server is concerned, via the interface ppp0, it is connected directly to the ISP and doesn't need to worry about routing via the ADSL device (so doesn't get affected by the ADSL device doing NPAT or firewalling)
